intro: Cephaelis kennedyae, commonly known as the Kennedy's cephalelis, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Western Ghats in India. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
